content:
Pike Place Chowder is a great choice for lunch. You can't go wrong with their creamy, flavorful chowders and soups. Be sure to try their signature Pike Place Chowder, which is a creamy blend of clams, potatoes, onions, and celery. If you're feeling adventurous, try one of their other flavors like the Seafood Chowder or the Spicy Tomato Soup.

When you're there, take a stroll around Pike Place Market, and enjoy the sights and sounds of the historic market. You might even catch a glimpse of fishmongers in action, tossing salmon and other fish to each other as they prepare for the day's sales.

If you have time, pop into the original Starbucks store, which is just a few blocks away from Pike Place Chowder. It's a fun spot to grab a coffee or snack and take a photo in front of the iconic sign.

After lunch, you can take a walk along the waterfront, enjoy the views of Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains, and maybe even stop by the Seattle Aquarium or the Seattle Great Wheel.

I hope you have a fantastic lunch and a great time exploring Seattle!
